meanings.definition: Drolling (adjective): characterized by excessive or silly humor
meanings.sent1: The drolling clown made everyone laugh with his silly jokes.
meanings.sent2: Her drolling sense of humor always lightened the mood in the room.
meanings.sent3: The drolling puppy chased its tail in circles, amusing everyone around.
meanings.sent4: His drolling antics at the party turned the event into a comedy show.
meanings.sent5: The drolling cartoon characters on TV were unforgettable and brought joy to many viewers.

meanings.definition: Drolling (verb): to speak or act in a silly or foolish manner
meanings.sent1: She couldn't help drolling around when she was with her best friend.
meanings.sent2: The children were drolling and giggling during their playtime together.
meanings.sent3: He started drolling in class, causing the teacher to chuckle at his antics.
meanings.sent4: The comedian drolled on stage, making the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent5: The friends drolled around the park, enjoying each other's company and carefree spirit.
